title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 October 2013 - XWiki
content:
<UCC> has quit  
00:46 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
01:25 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
01:27 <sburjan`> has quit  
01:27 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>

04:56 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki

06:03 <Denis> has quit

07:07 <cjd> has joined #xwiki

07:29 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:45 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
07:47 <polx> has quit  
07:47 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
07:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
07:49 <polx> has quit  
07:51 <sburjan`> has quit  
07:51 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
07:59 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:08 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
08:13 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:29 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <UCC> has quit  
08:35 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: hi, for BFD I was looking at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9539# but I think it's easier for you to handle it, doesn't seem hard  
08:39 <polx> has quit  
08:43 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes I will look at it  
08:57 <vmassol> ok thanks  
09:11 <vmassol> cjd: good morning  
09:12 <msmeria> vmassol: good morning  
09:12 <cjd> gm  
09:12 <vmassol> cjd: I'm looking at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-342# and was wondering what this means: " in the case where the object contains a field that is not part of the current schema for its class". Any idea in how to reproduce this?  
09:13 <vmassol> not sure yet I'll be able to fix it (depends on the complexity) but first I need to reproduce/understand when it happens  
09:13 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
09:13 <msmeria> vmassol: if I edit Blog.BlogIntroduction, and then migrate to another version of XWiki shoudln't I get a merge conflict in the DW for that page ?  
09:13 <vmassol> only if there's a conflict msmeria ;)  
09:14 <vmassol> other it'll merge the changes without asking  
09:14 <msmeria> what defines a conflict ?  
09:14 <vmassol> \*otherwise  
09:14 <vmassol> when it cannot perform a 3-way merge between: original version, your version and new version. Now I don't know the details, tmortagne should know better  
09:15 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:15 <vmassol> I guess when there are 2 changes for the same line  
09:15 <tmortagne> you get a conflict if there is a conflict  
09:15 <vmassol> (is it a line level or char level btw?)  
09:15 <vmassol> \*at  
09:15 <tmortagne> otherwise we could not call that merging  
09:16 <tmortagne> it depends  
09:16 <msmeria> I deleted a couple of lines and also added some new ones  
09:16 <tmortagne> for document content it's line based for example  
09:16 <tmortagne> same for test area  
09:16 <tmortagne> but for string property like title for example it's char based  
09:16 <vmassol> ok  
09:17 <vmassol> msmeria: do you get the expected result or not? ::)  
09:17 <tmortagne> that's the only thing that really count yes  
09:17 <tmortagne> if you are not happy with the result when that's where you should raise an issue with the 3 versions  
09:18 <tmortagne> s/when/then/  
09:18 <msmeria> vmassol: I get the same page I had before migrating  
09:18 <tmortagne> is there any difference between the previous and new XAR ?  
09:19 <msmeria> I haven't checked  
09:19 <cjd> vmassol: not quite sure how you would go about reproducing it, the object/field system was replaced by sergiu after that time so it may not express itself, of course it would be nice if some of the internal code was to actually throw exceptions on DB level failures  
09:20 <vmassol> does cloneXObjects perform any DB actions, not sure?  
09:20 <vmassol> it's during the save after no?  
09:20 <cjd> mm you're probably right  
09:21 <vmassol> hmm then maybe we could close this issue as cannot reproduce now :) ?  
09:21 <vmassol> (if sergiu fixed something that doesn't make it happen anymore)  
09:22 <cjd> well he rewrote a significant chunk of related code so it's probably out with the old bugs and in with the new  
09:22 <vmassol> :)  
09:22 <cjd> actually it was a nice improvement  
09:22 <vmassol> ok I need to find out his jira issue  
09:26 <UCC> has quit  
09:39 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <vmassol> has quit  
10:18 <Panther\_1> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <Panther\_1> hi  
10:21 <Panther\_1> vmassol1: I still found no way to prevent xwiki to display the exceptions an I have  nice long list of them from an security scanner  
10:22 <Panther\_1> vmassol1: most of them are also working on xwiki.org  
10:24 <Panther\_1> anyone else here with an idea to prevent xwiki display exceptions to public users?  
10:41 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:09 <Slashman> hello, I'm trying to change the default logo on the default skin following the tutorial here : http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GettingStarted/ChangingTheLogoAndThePanels  
11:09 <Slashman> but this doesn't work, I have the new logo before login (by replacing manually the file /usr/lib/xwiki/skins/colibri/logo.png) but once logged, I have the xwiki logo...  
11:10 <Slashman> any help ?  
11:11 <gdelhumeau> Slashman: did you have changed the logo in the color theme?  
11:11 <Slashman> okay nevermind, I found it  
11:11 <Slashman> gdelhumeau: yeah, my bad, that's here  
11:12 <gdelhumeau> OK, I update the documentation then  
11:14 <Slashman> wow, thanks ;)  
11:19 <Panther\_1> vmassol1: so i have filled a bug about it http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9541  
11:31 <vmassol1> Panther\_1: saw that!  
11:33 <Panther\_1> vmassol1: I think other company's will run also in this cause the professional security scan services will complain about this  
11:34 <vmassol1> I don't understand the security aspect of this. For sure lots of companies have already scanned xwiki for security and this has never been reported so far  
11:35 <tmortagne> I don't see what this has to do with security either  
11:37 <Panther\_1> tmortagne: not this exceptions but it is never a good Idea to print exception with sensitive Information like code line versions and so on to public  
11:38 <Panther\_1> tmortagne: I would preferr a way that the user is informed that there was an error, with an reference. With this refrence a user with admin rights or something can get the exception  
11:38 <Panther\_1> tmortagne: that this that is mean as Information Leakage  
11:38 <vmassol1> ok but since xwiki is open source you can always look at the source  
11:39 <vmassol1> so it's probably less an issue than with closed software  
11:39 <vmassol1> (where it's security by ignorance)  
11:39 <vmassol1> (compared to security by more eyes)  
11:39 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> on a brand new compiled snapshot, when I start xwiki-enterprise:  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> Caused by:  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> at  
11:40 <Panther\_1> vmassol: yes your right but it needs than a deeper view to it to use it instead of running some robots against productive sites  
11:41 <vmassol> yeah ok sure but IMO it's still small priority vs other security issues we know about ;)  
11:42 <Panther\_1> vmassol: yes it is, but I thing it's worth to take a look at it cause it can give you more time to fix secuirty problems  
11:42 <vmassol> FYI security issues are marked "confidential" in our jira  
11:43 <vmassol> and they're hidden by default  
11:43 <vmassol> we have a special security mailing list to discuss them  
11:43 <vmassol> Panther\_1: ok  
11:51 <Panther\_1> vmassol: I found this https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Information\_Leakage  said all to it  
11:51 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: same for me, vmassol looks like you made a mistake when modifying the component.txt  
11:52 <tmortagne> "script.script"  
11:52 <vmassol> sorry about that  
11:52 <vmassol> where?  
11:52 <tmortagne> diff module in commons  
11:52 <vmassol> diff module  
11:52 <vmassol> ok checking  
11:52 <vmassol> indeed  
11:55 <vmassol> Panther\_1: sorry, I'm in a meeting ATM, hence my slowness  
11:55 <vmassol> thanks for the link  
11:55 <Panther\_1> vmassol: no problem  
11:58 <ldubost> has quit  
11:59 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
12:01 <ldubost> has quit  
12:08 <vmassol> has quit  
12:11 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <gdelhumeau> is there a way to disable AS events and to enable it again after?  
12:21 <gdelhumeau> this.observation.notify(new XARImportingEvent(), null, xcontext); can do the job?  
12:21 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: not sure, I guess you could remove the AS listener and register it again  
12:22 <gdelhumeau> I just don't want AS to record events when I am creating a new wiki  
12:22 <vmassol> all happens in ActivityStreamImpl  
12:23 <vmassol> onEvent() method  
12:23 <vmassol> so either:  
12:23 <vmassol> - you unregister and register again against the OM  
12:24 <vmassol> - you modify ActivityStreamImpl to introduce some setActive(boolean) method used in onEvent()  
12:24 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you don't need to disable the listener for this plus disabling the listener mean it will disabled for all threads  
12:25 <vmassol> indeed it's an issue with the other threads  
12:25 <vmassol> there's only 1 for all  
12:25 <tmortagne> you can use ObservationContext to check where you are, look at autowatch listener in watchlist  
12:26 <tmortagne> it's doing exactly what you want to do  
12:26 <vmassol> ah didn't know about ObservationContext :)  
12:26 <tmortagne> vmassol: I'm pretty sure you are using it in the IRC bot  
12:26 <tmortagne> for the same reason  
12:27 <gdelhumeau> ok, found it  
12:27 <vmassol> don't remember, why would I use it?  
12:27 <gdelhumeau> / Does not auto-watch updated or created documents when they are in the context of a XAR import or a Wiki  
12:27 <gdelhumeau>         // creation.  
12:27 <gdelhumeau>             documentModifiedHandler(event, currentDoc, context);  
12:27 <gdelhumeau>         }  
12:27 <tmortagne> vmassol: to not report document modification event on IRC when importing a XAR  
12:28 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
12:28 <vmassol> no I don't use that  
12:28 <vmassol> I check XARImportingEvent  
12:28 <vmassol> and XARImportedEvent  
12:29 <tmortagne> from what I remember I told you about ObservationContext just before you start filtering imports so I tough you were using it  
12:29 <vmassol> ok, I don't remember but you probably told me and I just don't remember ;)  
12:30 <vmassol> in any case, cool that there's a way to do this  
12:32 <vmassol> so gdelhumeau could also do the same and just check for WikiCreatingEvent and WikiCreatedEvent I guess  
12:32 <vmassol> (do they exist?)  
12:32 <tmortagne> they exist  
12:32 <vmassol> cool  
12:33 <tmortagne> but would probably be better to introduce WikiCopyingEvent, WikiCopiedEvent already exist  
12:33 <tmortagne> and filter on that  
12:36 <gdelhumeau> great, it does the job  
12:37 <vmassol> hmmm how do you do it guillaume?  
12:37 <vmassol> you're modifying the AS code?  
12:37 <gdelhumeau> yes  
12:37 <vmassol> this is bad  
12:37 <vmassol> very bad  
12:37 <vmassol> the AS shouldn't know about other modules  
12:38 <vmassol> you're going to increase the technical debt  
12:38 <vmassol> so imagine someone codeing a new extension  
12:38 <vmassol> and he doesn't want the AS to log for his stuff  
12:38 <vmassol> he'll modify the AS code?  
12:38 <vmassol> that's definitely not a good solution  
12:39 <gdelhumeau> so I can introduce a method disableAS() and enableAS()  
12:39 <vmassol> this is why I was suggesting to tell the AS to not log stuff for some time instead  
12:39 <vmassol> yes, using some threadlocal  
12:39 <gdelhumeau> wiki manager should be aware of AS  
12:40 <gdelhumeau> \*should not  
12:40 <vmassol> it should  
12:40 <vmassol> if you don't want the AS to log then it means the wiki manager knows about AS  
12:40 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: a better solution would be to configure event ignored by AS  
12:40 <tmortagne> and no I don't thing wiki manger should know about AS  
12:40 <vmassol> someone has to know  
12:41 <vmassol> and it's definitely not the AS  
12:41 <vmassol> again take the use case I mentioned  
12:41 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: and we provide a default list of ignored events for XE including XAR import  
12:41 <tmortagne> that way nobody knows about the other  
12:41 <vmassol> and where do you configure this list?  
12:41 <vmassol> in your module  
12:41 <tmortagne> in xwiki.cfg or xwiki.properties  
12:42 <gdelhumeau> it was for the BFD...  
12:42 <tmortagne> all the module knows is that it get a list of event classes  
12:42 <vmassol> I don't think it needs to surface as a config  
12:42 <vmassol> it could but it doesn't have to  
12:43 <tmortagne> it have to if wiki manager does not know about AS and AS does not know about that event  
12:43 <vmassol> wiki manager should know about AS  
12:43 <vmassol> for the simple reason that  
12:43 <tmortagne> I don't see why  
12:43 <vmassol> wiki manager doesn't want to log stuff in the AS  
12:43 <tmortagne> and it's not only about wiki manager  
12:43 <vmassol> it's the wiki manager that decides this  
12:43 <vmassol> it's a feature of wiki manager  
12:43 <tmortagne> it's about anything that import a XAR  
12:44 <tmortagne> wiki manager is not the one doing the import  
12:44 <tmortagne> that's the packager  
12:44 <tmortagne> so not it's not a feature of wiki manager, what we want to filter is XAR import  
12:44 <tmortagne> not XAR import done when creating a wiki  
12:44 <vmassol> I was talking  about wiki creation by wiki manager  
12:45 <vmassol> now if you're talking about XAR importing in general it's of course different  
12:45 <tmortagne> but we don't care about that  
12:45 <vmassol> whoever is doing the XAR importing  then has to know  
12:45 <vmassol> it's part of its use case that AS shouldn't log  
12:45 <vmassol> so if it's the packager then it's ok that the packager knows about AS  
12:45 <vmassol> (possibily in a packager-as module if we don't want to make that a hard dep)  
12:46 <vmassol> (I was commenting generally speaking)  
12:46 <vmassol> (about who should know the other or not)  
12:46 <vmassol> only thing I'm sure is that AS shouldn't know  
12:46 <vmassol> :)  
12:50 <gdelhumeau> so, should I create disableAS() or a customizable list of event classes that AS must ignore?  
12:58 <vmassol> it's not the same use case  
12:59 <vmassol> if you wish to allow some extension to temporarily tell the AS to ignore some events then it's disable() and if the use case is about always ignoring some evens it's configuration  
12:59 <vmassol> for your need the configuration solution is good enough  
13:03 <vmassol> btw you'll need to specify the begin/end event pairs for group events so that you can ignore everything in between, or you just specify the BeginEvent and wait till the next EndEvent, using a Stack to match nested Begin/EndEvent...  
13:04 <vmassol> (not stack, but counter)  
13:05 <gdelhumeau> Can't I use the ObservationManager ?  
13:06 <vmassol> I don't understand  
13:06 <gdelhumeau> / Does not record some ignored events  
13:06 <gdelhumeau>         ObservationContext observationContext = Utils.getComponent(ObservationContext.class);  
13:06 <gdelhumeau>         }  
13:06 <gdelhumeau> where IGNORED\_EVENTS is customizable  
13:06 <vmassol> ah yes you can  
13:07 <vmassol> you can use ObservationContext  
13:07 <gdelhumeau> great  
13:32 <gdelhumeau> am I starting well? http://hastebin.com/cirokavawu.m  
13:32 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <Slash\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <evalica> has quit  
13:34 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: no, you should get as a List  
13:34 <vmassol> from the configuration  
13:34 <vmassol> also you're using the wrong CL  
13:35 <vmassol> imagine that you specify an event located in an extension  
13:35 <vmassol> the CL you use is the one that loaded the AS code  
13:35 <vmassol> so it won't be able to load the class  
13:35 <vmassol> you need to use the thread context CL  
13:35 <Slashman> has quit  
13:36 <vmassol> ideally we should have an ActivityStreamConfiguration component class but since it's some old code prior to components, what you have is acceptable for getting a property I guess  
13:37 <Slashman\_> has quit  
13:40 <vmassol> cjd: have you seen this bug report: https://github.com/WhiteHouse/fortyfour/issues/3 ? ;)  
13:40 <vmassol> you're probably affected too  
13:43 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
13:45 <vmassol> sdumitriu: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-1922?focusedCommentId=77631&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-77631  
14:00 <ldubost> has quit  
14:20 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:26 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Did you try on Tomcat?  
14:26 <vmassol> sdumitriu: nope  
14:30 <vmassol> trying with tomcat sdumitriu  
14:32 <vmassol> sdumitriu: no error in tomcat either  
14:32 <vmassol> maybe I'm not doing the right thing?  
14:32 <sdumitriu> Hm...  
14:32 <vmassol> I just click the "x" in my browser  
14:32 <vmassol> to stop the aloding  
14:32 <sdumitriu> Yes, that should be enough  
14:33 <sdumitriu> vmassol: This one pops up often in the logs for export html URLs  
14:33 <sdumitriu> Try that  
14:33 <sdumitriu> Click export HTML, then cancel as soon as you get the prompt  
14:33 <sdumitriu> Might not be fast enough on a local computer  
14:35 <vmassol> done that, no error  
14:35 <sdumitriu> Tomcat 6 or 7?  
14:35 <vmassol> (on my page which has the groovy sleep code)  
14:35 <vmassol> 7  
14:35 <sdumitriu> OK, might be something that only affects 6  
14:36 <vmassol> wait  
14:36 <vmassol> got it now  
14:36 <vmassol> when I tried a second time  
14:36 <sdumitriu> Oh, this doesn't pop up as soon as you cancel  
14:36 <sdumitriu> It pops up after a socket timeout  
14:36 <sdumitriu> (I think)  
14:37 <vmassol> now  
14:37 <vmassol> I'm not sure if we want to do something about this  
14:37 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-1922#comment-77638  
14:38 <sdumitriu> Can you try on Jetty now?  
14:38 <vmassol> ok  
14:38 <mflorea> tmortagne: I commented on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6338 (you can probably close it as Cannot Reproduce)  
14:39 <sburjan> Hello. can someone tell me which is the default life of a session cookie in XWiki ?  
14:39 <vmassol> sdumitriu: got it too  
14:40 <vmassol> so what's the issue? That it fills the logs unnecessarily?  
14:40 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Quick solution: change the logging settings not to print this error  
14:40 <sdumitriu> Yes  
14:40 <sdumitriu> I don't think there are any side effects  
14:41 <vmassol> no side effects and the log looks good  
14:41 <sdumitriu> Except maybe if there's some bad code that doesn't release things in a finally block  
14:41 <vmassol> only issue is as you say the filling of the logs  
14:41 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: what does CL mean?  
14:41 <vmassol> classloader  
14:41 <vmassol> changing the log settings is not easy sdumitriu  
14:41 <vmassol> what would you change?  
14:42 <sdumitriu> java.net.SocketOutputStream  
14:42 <vmassol> I doubt that SOS performs any printing does it?  
14:42 <sdumitriu> Hm...  
14:43 <sdumitriu> Right, that's the one that throws the error, not the one that's printin  
14:43 <vmassol> only code printing is:  
14:43 <vmassol>                 "Exception while exporting", e);  
14:43 <vmassol> ie inside XWikiException  
14:45 <vmassol> we could still filter it we wanted  
14:45 <vmassol> I'll try something  
14:48 <sdumitriu> has quit  
14:51 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <tmortagne> mflorea: you can close XWIKI-6338 IMO  
15:01 <mflorea> tmortagne: great, thanks!  
15:09 <vmassol> sdumitriu: let me know if this is ok for you.  
15:10 <vmassol> (I've tested it and it works)  
15:15 <Denis> has quit  
15:16 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <sburjan> has quit  
15:22 <UCC> has quit  
15:25 <sdumitriu> vmassol: I wonder if in a different locale that message is translated or not  
15:25 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
15:25 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I wondered about that too but I doubt it  
15:26 <sdumitriu> It uses getMessage internally, AFAIK that one isn't translated  
15:26 <vmassol> the risk is more of a different JVM impl IMO  
15:26 <vmassol> with a different message  
15:26 <vmassol> we should check openjdk for ex  
15:27 <vmassol> in any case it won't do any harm  
15:27 <sdumitriu> Right  
15:33 <Panther\_1> has quit  
15:37 <vmassol> tmortagne: I see that there's reflections 0.9.9RC1 and that we're using 0.9.7, is that voluntary?  
15:37 <vmassol> I'm asking because ATM xwiki doesn't deploy on weblogic because of http://code.google.com/p/reflections/issues/detail?id=124  
15:37 <tmortagne> vmassol: waiting a final version  
15:37 <tmortagne> https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-204  
15:37 <vmassol> ok going to try with 0.9.9RC1  
15:37 <vmassol> see if it helps  
15:41 <vmassol> yep works!

15:47 <vmassol> for weblogic not starting  
15:48 <vmassol> your issue has a wrong component too :)  
15:48 <vmassol> it's not a build issue, build issues don't affect users  
15:48 <vmassol> the component "Build, infra and tests" are supposed to contain issues that don't affetc users  
15:48 <tmortagne> reflection version is defined in root pom  
15:48 <vmassol> this is what I said yes  
15:49 <tmortagne> and as you can see in all related upgrade issue we use that component  
15:49 <vmassol> which is wrong  
15:49 <vmassol> well  
15:49 <vmassol> it depends  
15:49 <vmassol> it's ok if there's no change for the user  
15:49 <vmassol> so if you just upgrade for the sake of uprgrading it can be ok  
15:50 <tmortagne> it is a build issue, you package a different version of a dependency  
15:50 <vmassol> but if you upgade because there's a known bug  
15:50 <vmassol> then it's not correct  
15:50 <vmassol> "the component "Build, infra and tests" are supposed to contain issues that don't affetc users"  
15:50 <vmassol> it's for categorizing issues that you exclude from automatic release notes  
15:51 <vmassol> ie build-related stuff, like enabling checkstyle, erc  
15:51 <vmassol> but not for runtime thingfs  
15:52 <tmortagne> vmassol: then chance all the upgrade issue we did until now...  
15:52 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HRule:Don27tcreateunnecessaryissues  
15:52 <vmassol> yes we need to do that I think
